meanings.definition: Trocked (verb): past tense of trock - to move or travel at a steady pace
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I trocked to the park to meet my friends.
meanings.sent2: The train trocked along the tracks smoothly and quietly.
meanings.sent3: The turtle trocked past the hare in the race, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Time trocked forward, never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The river trocked lazily through the valley, reflecting the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Trocked (adjective): having a steady and consistent movement or pace
meanings.sent1: The trocked horse carried the rider steadily through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The trocked metronome kept the rhythm perfectly during the music class.
meanings.sent3: The trocked clock never missed a beat, ticking away the hours.
meanings.sent4: Her trocked heartbeat calmed her nerves before the performance.
meanings.sent5: The trocked pendulum swung back and forth with precision.
